publicationStmt.p: for use by whoever wants it

body.p:
Adds markup for recipes in the cooking domain.
My TEI Customization starts with modules tei, core, textstructure and header.

elementSpec.desc: A single ingredient used in the recipe, e.g. sugar, flour or garlic.

attDef.desc: Should point to a place, which provides more information on the given ingredient (for example to the xml:id of a cueML ingredient element)
States that the ingredient is optional to use (for example in "add sugar, if not sweet enough").

Ingredients can be alternative to each other within a recipe. This attribute is a unique identifier within the recipe for an alternative group. This attribute is combined with the "alt" element (for example "use <recipeIngredient altGrp='1'>wine</recipeIngredient> or <recipeIngredient altGrp='2'>rum</recipeIngredient> and <recipeIngredient altGrp='2'>liqueur</recipeIngredient> <alt target="1 2"/>)

Should point to a recipe of the ingredient, when the ingredient is a recipe by itself (for example use target-attribute for a link to a dumpling recipe when the added ingredient is dumpling but ref-attribute for a basic ingredient like salt).
Indicates the envisaged yield of the ingredient's quantity, specified in served people.
States that the ingredient should not be used (for example in "roast without butter).

elementSpec.desc: The time it takes to actually cook the dish, in ISO 8601 duration format.

attDef.desc: Identifies a recipe by giving its entry in the original TOC.

elementSpec.desc: The method of cooking, such as Frying, Steaming, ...
The category of the recipe—for example, appetizer, entree, etc.
The cuisine of the recipe (for example, French or Ethiopian).
A step or instruction involved in making the recipe.
The quantity produced by the recipe (for example, number of people served, number of servings, etc).
Indicates a dietary restriction or guideline for which this recipe is suitable, e.g. diabetic, halal etc.
The total time it takes to prepare and cook the recipe, in ISO 8601 duration format.
List of ingredient elements in the cooking domain.
Describes the preferred basis form / lemmatization of the ingredient.
Describes an alternative possible basis form / lemmatization of the ingredient.

attDef.desc: A reference to the BLS-key of the ingredient to the Bundeslebensmittelschlüssel (https://blsdb.de/)

elementSpec.desc: Defines an ingredient in the cooking domain.

attDef.desc: specifies the number of the specified units that comprise the measurement - also vague values / text like "some" or "a little bit" are allowed
